alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:02PM EST until February 21 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At Beverly affecting Washington County. For the Muskingum River...Minor flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At Beverly. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Low areas, and farmland, camps, and a few homes are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 31.84 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EST Friday was 33.28 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 27.0 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.2 feet on 04/04/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 915 AM EST.
